title: BrightHouse to expand with 20 new stores across Britain after 'turbulent' year
text: BrightHouse to expand with 20 new stores across Britain after 'turbulent' year BrightHouse to expand with 20 new stores across Britain after 'turbulent' year RENT-to-own group BrightHouse is to open 20 new stores as spending picks up after a “turbulent” year for furniture retailers. PUBLISHED: 21:44, Wed, Jul 1, 2015 | UPDATED: 21:48, Wed, Jul 1, 2015 PH BrightHouse is due to open 20 new stores Related articles Home goods chain BrightHouse thinking big: Plans to expand with 20... The expansion this year will include the roll-out of smaller satellite outlets following the successful trial of a neighbourhood store in Saltcoats, Scotland. The 300-plus chain, owned by private equity firm Vision Capital, saw growth in revenue from stores open at least two years slow to 3.9 per cent from 6.9 per cent the previous year. Pre-tax profit jumped 16 per cent to £19.6million on 5.5 per cent higher revenue of £351.7million. Over a quarter of new customers originated online. Chief executive Leo McKee sees the potential to open about 150 satellite stores and a similar number of 2,500 sq ft main stores. He said: “Our flexible and convenient offer continues to resonate with our customers.”
